name: Using the Game Expectations Sheet
guidance: The Game Expectations tracking sheet is a tool you can use to set expectations at the start of a game and ensure the game is fun for everyone.
Before distributing the sheet to players, fill in the two topmost boxes: Game Theme and Flavor, and Potentially Sensitive Elements.
Once the above information is added, give a copy of the sheet to each player. Players can fill out their sheets anonymously, but ask each of them to add limits and hopes/expectations/concerns.
Collect all the sheets, and gather your players' limits into a separate, anonymous document the whole group can access.
